Text: Publius (or Gaius) Cornelius Tacitus ( ; ] ;  56 AD –  120 AD ) was a senator and a historian of the Roman Empire.

Triplets:<Publius Cornelius Tacitus
1:
--------------------
Text: Tacitus:  The surviving portions of his two major works—the "Annals" and the "Histories"—examine the reigns of the Roman emperors Tiberius, Claudius, Nero, and those who reigned in the Year of the Four Emperors (69 AD).
Triplets:<Tacitus
3:
--------------------
Text: Tacitus:  There are substantial lacunae in the surviving texts, including a gap in the "Annals" that is four books long.
Triplets:<Tacitus
